file_content.text: I sense no imminent threat, Master. But we must always be on guard.
Ah, you caught me marveling at our accomplishments. I will regain my focus.
Master, I feel compelled to tell you--I'm a bit uneasy about Captain Quinn.
Training with the Jedi, I fought hundreds of Quinns--it's hard not to see him as the enemy.
Master, I feel compelled to tell you--I'm a bit uneasy about Lieutenant Pierce.
Training with the Jedi, I fought hundreds of Pierces--it's hard not to see him as the enemy.
Tell me, what will happen when he discovers that we're hoping to reform the Empire?
He must not find out.
Quinn is a die-hard Imperial patriot. If he learns the truth about us, he could become a problem.
Pierce is a ruthless soldier who bleeds Imperial. If he learns the truth about us, he could become a problem.
Not in the least.
So, do not openly discuss our plans unless we are in private.
When the time comes, he'll see that the Empire is better off, or he will have to be eliminated.
He will adapt or die.
Every precaution must be taken so that the truth is protected.
We must never be discovered.
When the time comes, those able to see that the Empire is better off will unite with us; the others will have to be eliminated.
Everyone will pick sides.
It's not your concern. I have everything under control.
Let me worry about that.
Just don't discuss our greater plans unless you and I are in private.
This work is so grim. And I must learn to play the part of the dark apprentice.
I've always despised those who pretend to be what they are not. Now it seems I've joined their ranks.
It has to become natural, Jaesa. Second nature.
Learn to act.
You must keep your sights on the goal, and be ready to do whatever it takes.
The ends justify the means.
I hear you, master. I will follow your lead.
If you can't be strong, you're useless to me.
Stop crying.
I understand, master. Don't worry.
I'm going to show you that you made the right decision taking me on.
I've grown to respect your tempered and patient approach to our goals.
It will take a lot of work to get there.
We are still a long way off.
Well, I am here for the duration.
We have made great strides, Jaesa.
All is proceeding well.
My strides have become much longer, now that I walk in your footsteps.
You are and will be an integral part of my future plans.
With you, Jaesa.
I'm proud to help you in your pursuits. I'm convinced we will make a great mark on this galaxy.
However I can serve, and whatever I can do to impart my gifts on your future offspring and followers, you can count on me.
You will be a valuable contributor, I'm sure.
I appreciate that.
Your confidence is not misplaced.
Nothing less than your best effort will be acceptable.
Be sure of it.
Always, master.
It would make sense for us to procreate--our offspring would have great advantages.
We should have a child.
I see the logic, master. And it would be my honor.
I encourage you to have children, Jaesa. Perhaps your power of clarity can be passed down.
Your offspring, as well.
And I will train and guide your family as my own.
You honor me, master.
Jaesa, you've returned. Should I assume you defeated Lord Cendence?
You have accomplished much, Jaesa. Well done.
Congratulations.
Do not assume that you are impervious. You must always maintain humility.
Don't be over confident.
It is up to me, and me alone, to determine when you have reached the end of your journey.
I will be the judge.
I will respect that.
Of course.
You will tell me the details until I am satisfied.
What if I insist?
Whatever happened, rise above it, Jaesa. I need you focused.
Get over it.
The other night, I couldn't sleep. I sensed a kindred Sith who was in distress, and I ventured out.
I hope you were able to save him.
Was he beyond help?
I tried, but he was too severely ravaged.
You shouldn't have gone out alone, Jaesa.
Leaving like that was unwise.
I sensed no danger, master. Whatever attacked the man was long gone.
Be strong, will you? Your quivering is an embarrassment.
Suck it up.
I'll try, master. But the sight was disturbing.
All he was able to tell me was that a terrifying Sith discovered his nature and abducted him to a strange place.
He felt kindness in his last moments. Find solace in that.
Then he died with peace.
Your wisdom and clarity bolster me.
Do you have a sense of what's happened to the rest?
What about the others?
Good people die every day, Jaesa.
The galaxy is unfair.
I cannot harden my heart to it, master.
This kind of treachery cannot be tolerated.
He must be stopped.
You're not going to be able to let this go, are you?
Can you ignore this?
This Sith is your destiny, Jaesa. The test that will determine your place in the galaxy. You must confront him. Alone.
Then only you can face him.
You will either stand up to his torment and be confirmed, or you will succumb and fall to corruption.
He'll find more than he bargained for if he dares face me.
Let him come.
By pursuing the light side Sith, you now link us to their plight.
You have put us at risk.
You have what it takes, Jaesa. I know it.
I believe in you.
Hope is intangible--unreliable--you cannot stand on it.
Do not hope.
Fear will lead to the dark side. Conquer it or you have already lost.
Don't be frightened.
Master, I'm plagued.
We should make that a priority.
I agree.
If an answer presents itself, fine, otherwise we jettison this preoccupation.
Whatever happens happens.
Safety is an illusion, Jaesa. There will always be risk.
Nothing is secure.
He risks much operating right under the nose of the Dark Council.
Dangerous work.
That's the kind of daring we need around here.
I like his moxy.
Such foolishness. Won't be long before this Emmoridg is exposed and destroyed.
He's an idiot.
Emmoridg's pupils will be a great asset when the day to make our move on the Empire comes.
Please do.
The more who know us and are connected to us, the less secure we are.
It's too risky.
Use your special power and best judgment, Jaesa. Be sure each can be trusted before you draft them.
Be cautious.
Master, have you noticed how much more effective in battle I've become?
My mind is clearer than it's ever been. My powers feel amplified.
Your increased prowess is wonderful to see.
I've noticed.
Yes, I'm definitely anticipating attacks better.
What are you experiencing? Give me examples.
Tell me more.
I'm anticipating attacks with greater certainty.
And when I use my special power, things are more distinct with much less effort.
It's all thanks to your guidance, master.
Learn humility, Jaesa. Your accomplishments are noticed without you crowing about them.
Don't gloat.
My apologies, master. Sometimes I get overly excited.
I'm only glad that I will be of better service to you.
That is truly awful news.
A tragic shame.
I understand your despair, Jaesa, but this is not your fault. You tried--no matter the outcome, you did the right thing.
Stop whimpering like a child!
Calm yourself!
To achieve our goals, we will have to do many things we do not wish. You must be stronger than this!
Have no sympathy for them. The closed-minded will always suffer.
The fools.
Hope is only lost if we fall. As nice as it would be to have the assistance of others, we must rely on ourselves alone.
You have something to tell me?
Don't pretend to understand Sith business, but you're not allying with traitorous Sith, are you?
Please explain what you meant, my dark apprentice.
Cat got your tongue, Jaesa?
Yes, right. I can do that. If I must explain myself to a lowly Imperial....
Sith who do not embrace the dark side will all be destroyed. Count on it.
Let your rage out, my apprentice.
Elaborate for him.
The most painful deaths shall be reserved for the traitors to the dark side that I uncover. Maybe he'd like to sample it!
Exactly as I would have put it.
Well said, Jaesa.
Great dark minds think alike, my master.
Does that sufficiently ease your Imperial concerns?
Satisfied, Pierce?
This does not concern you, Pierce.
Mind your business.
My apprentice has a delightful sense of humor--by "befriend" she means "behead."
Don't worry, Pierce.
Noted. Won't happen again.
Sorry, master, I was just so excited about my discoveries I forgot myself. I hope he bought it.
If you flounder like that again, it will be the last time.
For your sake.
Of course, master. It won't happen again.
The situation is under control. He is none the wiser.
Nothing to worry about.
I hope you're right. I'll be doubly careful from now on.
He might still be suspicious.
I'm not sure.
I won't ever mess up like that again, I promise.
These Sith will be wary, but I have no doubt your enthusiasm will win them over.
Go to them. You'll do well.
It won't be easy. I hope you can handle this responsibility.
Don't blow this opportunity.
Temper your expectations, Jaesa. This is a long road we're on, and these Sith may not be what you expect.
I wouldn't be so excited.
Master, I should have requested an audience with you some time ago. I have exciting news!
In an effort to pull my own weight, I've been reaching out with my senses.
I'm becoming aware of other Sith who operate in contradiction to the Empire.
Quiet down, Jaesa. The ship has ears.
Remain poised.
Sorry, master, my excitement sometimes gets the better of me.
How do you know this?
Tell me.
As I train and my sense of purpose becomes clearer, I find I'm able to scan entire planets or even quadrants of space.
I find that very hard to believe.
That's far-fetched.
It took me by surprise as well, but I'm telling you I'm almost one hundred percent sure.
As my senses reach out, I recognize certain signatures--several that are like looking into a mirror.
I'm seeing the same insecurity that I feel as I feign loyalty to the Empire. If there are others like us, we should find them!
Continue your efforts to locate these Sith and confirm their nature.
Try to pinpoint them.
Thank you, master! It might take some time, but I'm on it.
I don't have time to entertain guesses. Don't bother me unless you have concrete leads.
Get proof or I don't care.
Yes, master. I should know better. I'll dedicate myself to uncovering the truth.
This must be handled delicately, Jaesa. I'd rather you didn't pursue it than risk exposing us.
Be careful.
Master, may I break character for a moment? Speak as a Jedi?
I don't have a lot of time, Jaesa, but speak your mind.
Be quick.
Say what you must, but do it quietly.
Whisper.
Of course. There's something I must confess.
You must be believable, Jaesa. So stay in character as often as possible.
Don't make it a habit.
I'll try to be brief. I have a confession to make.
As a handmaiden on Alderaan, I was surrounded by the falseness of the nobles and their political agendas.
I could have used my power to expose it all and bring a corrupt system to its knees. But out of fear, I held back.
What were you afraid of?
Tell me why.
Maybe of revealing that I'm different. Or of not being strong enough to back it up and see it through.
Even now, I wonder if it's your strength that will enable me to succeed, and not my own fortitude.
You have grown since those days, Jaesa. Have confidence.
I see great strength in you.
Your belief in me goes a long way, master.
Maybe you're not strong enough on your own. There's no shame in that.
So what if it is?
It's so easy to talk to you.
These kinds of ruminations will only hold you back.
Self-doubt is your weakness.
You sound like Nomen Karr. Will you always chastise me when I come to you with my concerns?
I believe in what we're doing, and my confidence is growing.
They would have found a way to ruin you and continue. Politics cannot survive without deception and manipulation.
It would have done no good.
Wait, but we're trying to gain power and influence within the Empire in order to affect meaningful change.
If you're saying the politics of Alderaan can't be changed, what hope do we have?
Our tactics won't always be savory.
We won't be gentle.
We will represent the Empire's evolution. And evolution is inevitable.
Things do change.
Your words inspire me, master.
The task that faces us is monumental. We must not waver.
Very little.
Whatever is to come, I am with you.
I've seen the results that your actions bring. It gives me hope.
You must not use the Force to dictate change to others.
That would have been abuse.
But aren't we doing just that--using our powers to force change on the Empire?
What's the difference between changing Alderaan politics and changing the Empire?
Changing the Empire will save countless lives and bring peace to the galaxy.
The good it will bring.
The politics of Alderaan are insignificant in comparison. I see now.
You're missing the point. We will offer an alternative--it will be up to the Empire to take it.
We will only influence.
Otherwise, it would just be trading one tyranny for another. I understand now.
If you can't tell the difference, perhaps you are not worth my time.
I shouldn't have to explain.
I will ponder it.
Still. I know myself--there's some of that Alderaanian handmaiden left in me. And I can get discouraged without tangible progress.
It's not going to occur on its own--stop waiting for progress and create it yourself.
Then make something happen.
Yes, it's time I began applying myself. Thank you for the push.
You must be sure, even in the absence of any proof.
I expect blind faith.
After all I've been through, it's hard to summon.
I promise, we will build toward success.
You will see progress.
Promises are a good start.
Please bear with me, master, I have much to learn.
Master, when we return to the ship, I hope we can take a moment and talk.
Master, when you have a moment, I'd like to speak with you.
Please, master, let's talk later.
Master, I feel compelled to tell you--I'm uneasy fighting alongside diehard Imperials.
It seems like a foolish risk--we are always surrounded by the enemy.
If it's discovered that we're working to reform the Empire, what will we do? What will happen?
Master, I am aware of no doubt nor insecurity within me. My clarity has never been more pronounced.
Someday, I know you will take the Empire in a new direction and bring lasting peace.
Master, it is done. Overseer Emmoridg and his pupils are safe. Lord Cendence is no more.
He was pure malevolence, like nothing I'd ever imagined. He tried to twist and unnerve me, but I emerged from the battle grounded and sure.
The new start you gave me--this journey of discovery you have enabled--is complete.
I feel neither pride, nor thankfulness, nor relief. It simply is what it is.
Yes, master. But know that I turned away from pure darkness and have been engulfed by the light forever.
Forgive me, master. You may make whatever determination you feel is indicated. But I know what I know.
My fight with Cendence was the most intense and difficult experience of my life.
But the details are meaningless, so do not ask me to elaborate.
Thank you, master.
This one time I must defy you. It is for me alone, master.
You will find that my focus will never lag again, master.
Now, I must meditate.
Master, a terrible development.
When I found him, I realized he was one of Overseer Emmoridg's pupils. But he was shockingly wounded, his body twisted and dying.
He said other of Emmoridg's students were rounded up as well. I sensed pain and cruelty like I've never imagined. He died in my arms.
I do, master. And it chills me.
I've reached out to the others and become aware of their captor. One of the most concentrated sources of malice I've ever encountered.
A Sith Lord named Cendence. He is systematically hunting light side Sith and torturing them into darkness or death.
I feel compelled to confront this monster.
Sounds awful.
Yes. I feel compelled to confront this monster.
I'm sorry, master. I feel compelled to confront this monster.
It's only a matter of time before he discovers Overseer Emmoridg, and possibly even us.
Master, I grow hollow. I hope I can weather this darkness.
Master, this is different.
Master, I feel this was inevitable.
Discovering Lord Cendence has filled me with a great sense of purpose. This is my trial. I must face him, alone.
I will either stand up to his torment and vanquish him. Or I will succumb and be corrupted. I hope I can weather this darkness.
Your belief strengthens me.
I understand, master.
I promise, I will return.
It's about Overseer Emmoridg. His work is so important--training Sith acolytes to secretly embrace the light.
I sense that he won't be able to hide much longer. If only we could help him find a secure way to continue his efforts.
It wouldn't be time poorly spent. As you have taught me, all that matters is that we try.
I'll dedicate myself to doing just that. Perhaps a plan will be present itself.
Yes, master. I'm sorry, I know you're right.
I know, master. But there's risk and then there's risk.
There has to be a place where he can work with more autonomy and less scrutiny.
But it's probably a dream. I'll try to remain at peace over it.
Master, one of the Sith I tried to connect to has contacted me. It seems he's ready to trust us!
His name is Lord Emmoridg. He's an overseer on Korriban who secretly trains hand-selected acolytes to follow the light.
I wholeheartedly agree, master. He is right under the nose of the Dark Council.
That's why he's seeking me out.
Emmoridg knows he won't last long, and he's hoping we'll look after his disciples. Help consolidate their power and guide them in the galaxy.
With your permission, I'd like to reach out to them and keep in contact.
To be sure. The longer he remains active, the bigger the army he builds for us.
Then I will secretly keep track of them, without exposing us. In case they can become a resource in the future.
Yes, master, I will err on the side of caution, always.
You're teaching me to find sustenance from within. Independent of outside forces and direct results.
And the moment I let go of my need for obvious progress, progress is achieved. This reinforces everything you have told me.
In light of my failure reaching out to the light side Sith, I have re-dedicated myself. Your example has helped me.
Master, I'm barely holding it together. My mission, to unite with the light-leaning Sith... it was awful.
They didn't trust me. Thought I was trying to trick them. The confusion I read in them... the fear... I still feel it.
What's worse--most of them fled, but a few... they attacked me and I had to... they forced my hand, Master.
It means so much to me that you're here. I hope your support helps drive the pain away.
Yes, master! I'm sorry to disappoint you.
I will try to learn to steel myself, and not be so desperate for results.
Please don't give up one me.
I'm beginning to understand what we're facing. I must learn to adopt your philosophy, or this will consume me.
This has been a difficult lesson. Thank you for your guidance and wisdom, master.
Yes, master! I have good news. I've located the Sith I sense who are secretly opposing the Empire!
It's unmistakable. They're clearly turning away from the dark side. I hope you'll allow me to reach out and befriend them.
Ahem. Often come here when I'm off duty. First time I ever heard anything interesting.
Clearly, an ignoramus like Pierce has never heard of sarcasm. By "befriend" of course I mean "behead."
His doubt mocks me.
Yeah, you're vicious. Reel it in, babe.
Now, doesn't this uniformed ape have work to do?
Scary broad. I get the hint.
Suppose so. Had to be sure.
I'll get back to my post.
Yes... right. Exactly, master.
Yes, that's right. Sith who dare betray the dark side will be hunted down and destroyed.
The lieutenant's insinuation is an insult. He'd better take care not to repeat the offense.
With your permission, I'll head out to find the light-leaning Sith I'm sensing.
It will be so invigorating to unite others like us. We can begin to build a movement!
Thank you for your belief in me.
I won't let you down.
I understand. But my hopes are alive.
I'm off! Wish me luck, master.
Master, I hope you have faith in me. I promise to take no unnecessary risks and to only act after you have been consulted.
Yes, master.
As you wish, master.
As you decree, my lord.
Your wisdom and clarity bolster me.
Yes, my lord.
Whatever is to come, I am with you.
I will do my best, my lord.
I won't let you down.
I hear you, master. I will follow your lead.
I'll be ready for your next order.
I will make you proud, I promise.
I'll do what I can, master.
Your intentions are... not knowable.
I'm going to show you that you made the right decision taking me on.
